decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Selesnya creature strategy, utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Collected Company to quickly establish a board presence. By combining efficient creatures with disruptive spells like Enduring Innocence and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to control the battlefield and apply pressure to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Voice of Resurgence and Ouroboroid provide resilience and card advantage to ensure the deck can maintain its aggressive momentum.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while disrupting opponents with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Using Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition to generate value and tempo, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of early aggression and resilient threats like Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The deck's mana base is optimized to support its low curve and maximize its aggressive potential, allowing it to consistently apply pressure and close out games quickly.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of removal spells and hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also leverages powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to control the board and generate value. The inclusion of cards like High Noon and Pest Control provide additional ways to deal with threats, while cards like Vanishing Verse and Fatal Push handle a variety of permanents. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing extra cards to maintain momentum. The key strategy is to outlast the opponent by denying their resources and eventually overwhelming them with powerful late-game threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Supreme Verdict. The deck also includes a mix of utility lands to help stabilize the mana base and provide additional advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Greasefang Parhelion combo to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that provide protection and removal to support the combo, as well as cards that can help dig for the necessary pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to generate advantage and secure victory.

Utilize a combination of disruptive spells and creatures to gain control of the game, while also utilizing powerful removal options and hand disruption to dismantle the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on establishing a strong board presence with creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Preacher of the Schism, while also utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse serves as a powerful finisher, while the Bleachbone Verge and Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber provide additional utility and mana fixing. Vanishing Verse offers versatile removal options against a variety of threats.

The deck focuses on using Retraction Helix to continuously bounce and replay cheap artifacts, triggering storm abilities and generating a lot of mana with Mox Amber. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells like Stock Up and Rona, Herald of Invasion. The deck aims to quickly assemble a combo of artifacts and spells to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a fast and explosive manner. The inclusion of cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Stormchaser's Talent helps to support the combo strategy and provide additional value to the deck.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of early aggression and disruptive elements, allowing it to maintain control of the battlefield and apply pressure consistently. The inclusion of Collected Company provides additional card advantage and allows for explosive turns, while cards like Branchloft Pathway and Razorverge Thicket help fix mana for a smooth curve.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing card advantage, counterspells, and removal to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With cards like March of Otherworldly Light for card draw and Supreme Verdict for board wipes, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can establish a dominant position. Key cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils provide additional card advantage and disruption to help secure the win. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Pinnacle Starcage to close out the game once control has been established.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, along with spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage. The deck also includes burn spells like Torch the Tower and Stormchaser's Talent to finish off opponents quickly. The deck focuses on early aggression and keeping up pressure on the opponent to disrupt their game plan and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, with an emphasis on maintaining a strong board presence with the help of Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck utilizes various cards to control the opponent's board, disrupt their strategies, and generate card advantage, ultimately allowing the player to outlast their opponent and secure victory through attrition. Additionally, the deck includes a few win conditions such as Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to close out the game once the opponent's defenses have been weakened.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures that can dominate the battlefield. The deck aims to strip away opponent's resources with Thoughtseize and Duress, while removing threats with Fatal Push, Vanishing Verse, and other removal spells. It also has access to strong finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, to end the game once it has taken control. The mana base is designed to support a combination of white and black spells, allowing for flexibility and consistency in casting spells.

The main idea of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy and control the board using a variety of removal spells and hand disruption. The deck aims to maintain control of the game by removing threats efficiently and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. Additionally, the deck features powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to further control the board and secure victory. With a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful threats, this deck excels at controlling the pace of the game and outlasting opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to use cheap and efficient creatures with prowess abilities like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. By including burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to control the board and clear any blockers that may get in the way of attacking with creatures. The deck also includes card draw and pump spells like Stock Up and Monstrous Rage to help maintain resources and increase the damage output of the creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on assembling powerful equipment such as Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe onto aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded. By utilizing cards like Sigarda's Aid and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck aims to quickly pump up its creatures and overwhelm the opponent with efficient combat damage. With a mix of equipment and creatures with built-in abilities, this deck aims to quickly take control of the board and pressure the opponent into submission before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw and scrying effects to help maintain card advantage and find key pieces of the control arsenal. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and synergy to the deck, allowing for additional utility and support in combat. The mana base is carefully curated to ensure smooth gameplay and access to the necessary colors for spells and abilities.
